summary: Email chain between a law firm partner at Boies Schiller Flexner LLP and FBI Victim Services regarding scheduling FBI briefings and interviews for victims of Jeffrey Epstein in October 2019. The correspondence discusses logistics for victim interviews, visa issues for a foreign victim, and security clearance for attorneys attending the briefings.

persons.name: Linda Carlsen
persons.context: Copied on an email to provide David Boies' social security information for security clearance to access the federal building for the victim briefing.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the perpetrator whose victims are being invited to FBI briefings.

connections.description: Carlsen is an assistant at the law firm representing victims of Epstein, facilitating attorney access to victim briefings.

events.title: FBI Victim Briefing in Florida
events.description: FBI Victim Services Division briefing for victims of Jeffrey Epstein held at the Miami Field Office.

events.title: FBI Victim Briefing in New York
events.description: FBI Victim Services Division briefing for victims of Jeffrey Epstein held at the New York Field Office.

locations: 1331 Ponce De Leon Drive, Fort Lauderdale, FL 33316
keyFacts: The FBI Victim Services Division organized briefings for victims of Jeffrey Epstein in October 2019 in both Florida and New York.
A law firm partner from Boies Schiller Flexner LLP was coordinating attendance for multiple clients/victims and planned to accompany them.
Discussions included scheduling FBI interviews for victims who had not been fully interviewed previously, with one interview estimated to last about 2 hours.
There was mention of a victim who had been brought to the US multiple times by Epstein and had interacted with many people, suggesting she possessed significant information.
Security protocols for federal building access required attorneys to provide personal information including social security numbers.
